          (b) Usui, S.; Hashimoto, Y.; Morey, J. V.; Wheatley, A. E.; Uchiyama, M. Direct ortho Cupration: A New Route to Regioselectively Functionalized Aromatics. J. Am. Chem. Soc. 2007, 129, 15102,  DOI: 10.1021/ja074669i
          [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
          18b
          Direct ortho Cupration: A New Route to Regioselectively Functionalized Aromatics
          Usui, Shinya; Hashimoto, Yuichi; Morey, James V.; Wheatley, Andrew E. H.; Uchiyama, Masanobu
          Journal of the American Chemical Society (2007), 129 (49), 15102-15103CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
          The authors have developed a direct regio- and chemoselective method for generating functionalized arom. cuprate compds. through deprotonative directed ortho cupration using TMP(tetramethylpiperidino)-cuprates (R(TMP)Cu(CN)Li2; R = alkyl, Ph, or TMP) that were prepd. by mixing of CuCN, RLi, and Li tetramethylpiperidide (LTMP) in THF. Deprotonative cupration of various functionalized benzenes with TMP-cuprate proved effective for the direct generation of o-functionalized Cu arom. and heteroarom. derivs., particularly those with electrophilic functional groups, such as cyano, amide, and halogens. Direct cupration, followed by electrophilic trapping, provided a convenient preparative method for 1,2- or 1,2,3-multisubstituted arom. compds., e.g. 95 % 2-iodo-1,3-dimethoxybenzene from 1,3-dimethoxybenzene. The functionalized arom. cuprate intermediates also undergo oxidn. reactions very efficiently and with high regio- and chemoselectivity to afford functionalized phenol, ligand(hetero)-coupling, or homocoupling products by appropriately changing the oxidants and cuprates. The crystal and mol. structures of (TMP)2Cu(CN)Li2THF were detd. by x-ray crystallog.
          >> More from SciFinder ®
          https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2sXhtlWmurnI&md5=5ad515bd80b1a8270c2daf04961e661d
          open URL
        19. 19
          Roy, K.; Vinod, C. P.; Gopinath, C. S. Design and Performance Aspects of a Custom-Built Ambient Pressure Photoelectron Spectrometer toward Bridging the Pressure Gap: Oxidation of Cu, Ag, and Au Surfaces at 1 mbar O2 Pressure. J. Phys. Chem. C 2013, 117, 4717,  DOI: 10.1021/jp312706s
          [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
          19
          Design and Performance Aspects of a Custom-Built Ambient Pressure Photoelectron Spectrometer toward Bridging the Pressure Gap: Oxidation of Cu, Ag, and Au Surfaces at 1 mbar O2 Pressure
          Roy, Kanak; Vinod, C. P.; Gopinath, Chinnakonda S.
          Journal of Physical Chemistry C (2013), 117 (9), 4717-4726CODEN: JPCCCK; ISSN:1932-7447. (American Chemical Society)
          The crit. features of a custom-built lab. version ambient pressure photoelectron spectrometer (Lab-APPES) are presented. A double front cone differential pumping arrangement and an aperture free design employed in the electrostatic lens regime improve the data collection and data quality. In contrast to the conventional x-ray photoelectron spectrometers (XPS) operating at ultrahigh vacuum (UHV), it is possible to explore the electronic structure of solid surfaces under working conditions or closer to working conditions with Lab-APPES. Esp. surface-dependent phenomena can be explored up to 1 mbar pressure and up to 873 K by conventional heating methods and at least up to 1273 K by a laser heating method. Simultaneous XPS and reaction kinetic measurements on solid surfaces make the Lab-APPES an important tool to measure the dynamic electronic structure changes on material surfaces under reaction conditions. The interaction of O2 with polycryst. foils of Cu, Ag, and Au from UHV to 1 mbar and up to 773 K was studied.
          >> More from SciFinder ®
          https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3sXit1ejsLo%253D&md5=0edb8e247a14c42e940b6693af8a4bc8
          open URL

          There is no corresponding record for this reference.
          open URL
        21. 21
          (a) Cossy, J.; Belotti, D.; Bellosta, V.; Brocca, D. Oxidative cleavage of 2-substituted cycloalkane-1,3-diones and of cyclic β-ketoesters by copper perchlorate/oxygen. Tetrahedron Lett. 1994, 35, 6089,  DOI: 10.1016/0040-4039(94)88083-2
          [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
          21a
          Oxidative cleavage of 2-substituted cycloalkane-1,3-diones and of cyclic β-keto esters by copper perchlorate/oxygen
          Cossy, J.; Belotti, D.; Bellosta, V.; Brocca, D.
          Tetrahedron Letters (1994), 35 (33), 6089-92CODEN: TELEAY; ISSN:0040-4039.
          A preparative method for the synthesis of (ω-1),ω-dioxo carboxylic acids and (ω-1)-oxoalkanedioic acid monoesters by resp. oxidative cleavage of 2-substituted cycloalkane-1,3-diones and cyclic β-keto esters, by copper perchlorate in acetonitrile in an oxygen atm., is reported.
          >> More from SciFinder ®
          https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADyaK2cXntVSnt7g%253D&md5=6c8745e0d900df69049a6b075ab2f75d
          open URL
          .
          (b) Li, D.; Yu, W. Oxygen Involved Oxidative Deacetylation of α Substituted β Acetyl Amides – Synthesis of α Keto Amides. Adv. Synth. Catal. 2013, 355, 3708,  DOI: 10.1002/adsc.201300660
          [Crossref], Google Scholar
          There is no corresponding record for this reference.
          open URL
          .
          (c) Steward, K. M.; Johnson, J. S. Asymmetric Synthesis of α-Keto Esters via Cu(II)-Catalyzed Aerobic Deacylation of Acetoacetate Alkylation Products: An Unusually Simple Synthetic Equivalent to the Glyoxylate Anion Synthon. Org. Lett. 2011, 13, 2426,  DOI: 10.1021/ol200649u
          [ACS Full Text ], Google Scholar
          There is no corresponding record for this reference.
          open URL
        22. 22
          Nandhikonda, P.; Paudel, S.; Heagy, M. D. Minimal modification approach to red-shifted absorption and fluorescence in 1,8-naphthalimides. Tetrahedron 2009, 65, 2173,  DOI: 10.1016/j.tet.2009.01.048
          [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
          22
          Minimal modification approach to red-shifted absorption and fluorescence in 1,8-naphthalimides
          Nandhikonda, Premchendar; Paudel, Sangita; Heagy, Michael D.
          Tetrahedron (2009), 65 (11), 2173-2177CODEN: TETRAB; ISSN:0040-4020. (Elsevier Ltd.)
          As a min. modification approach toward longer wavelength chromophores, a series of (4-diethylamino-1,8-naphthaloyl)-aminopyridines were prepd. with the pyridine nitrogen located at the ortho, meta, and para positions. Comparison between these isomeric neutral dyes and their corresponding pyridinium-1,3-propanesulfonate salts reveals a red-shift in both absorption (up to an emission of 1682 cm-1 in Et acetate) and emission. These obsd. shifts along with increased fluorescence quantum yield are attributed to polarization induced by the quaternary nitrogen of the pyridinium cation.
          >> More from SciFinder ®
          https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1MXit1ajur0%253D&md5=6035fea9ff249b8d2f33c94ad5177f47
          open URL
